definition: high and mighty (idiom); arrogant
toe
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]

sentences.english: Those who act high-and-mighty always are usually left alone by others.
sentences.chinese: 别人往往不会和趾高气扬的人过多交往。

sentences.english: Nor ought I to cease for an Instant to lavIsh upon her all that whIch she would dIsdaIn.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她趾高气扬，我也不应当停止向她倾诉衷肠。

sentences.english: The high-salaried manager replaced the swaggering tycoon.
sentences.chinese: 高薪的经理代替了趾高气扬的大老板。

sentences.english: The pompous lecturer is strutting ago or toth over the stage.
sentences.chinese: 这个演说者在台上趾高气扬地来回走着。

sentences.english: Vic pranced into the office and demanded to speak to the manager.
sentences.chinese: 维克趾高气扬地走进办公室，要求和经理讲话。

sentences.english: Galileo called the old strutting Aristotelian conservatives, The Pigeon League.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略称趾高气扬的亚斯多德派保守份子为鸽盟。

sentences.english: He is puffed up with pride.
Leafs will be astrut in breeze but chill when gale makes them falling down.
sentences.chinese: 树叶得势时趾高气扬，失意时威风扫地。

sentences.english: The male bird strutted in front of the female.
sentences.chinese: 雄鸟在雌鸟面前趾高气扬地走着。

sentences.english: His father was peacocking about on the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲趾高气扬在草地上来回地走。？

definition: arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
overbearing/arrogant bully
arrogant
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
variant of 得意洋洋[de2 yi4 yang2 yang2]
arrogant and overbearing
docile/submissive
